intro: Simsia chaseae, commonly known as the Chase's Simsia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow florets arranged in a disc-like structure, surrounded by bracts that resemble petals. Simsia chaseae typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a subject of interest for botanists studying alpine flora.
